metadata.title: CVE-2014-1575 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 33.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrarycode via vectors related to improper interaction between threading andgarbage collection in the GCRuntime::triggerGC function in js/src/jsgc.cpp,and unknown other vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
